page.title: 13LINFORD MANOR, MILTON KEYNES
page.content: Great Linford Manor which is situated in Parklands through which the Grand Union Canal passes was built in 1678 by Sir William Pritchard who bought the land from the Napier family. He pulled down the older medieval manor and put up the centre block of the present building. The principle stonemason was George Kemp of Great Linford. In 1972 Great Linford Manor was bought by Milton Keynes Development Corporation to be an arts centre where it was used for various activities such as pottery, sculpting, painting, weaving, concerts and drama classes. Two barns were renovated and used for crafts. The old almshouses are still used by individual independent craftsmen for picture-framing, jewelry making an pottery. In 1984 M.K.D.C. withdrew their grant and the manor closed.
